title: Accidental viewing of confidential information
description: A ORG employee having access to user information breaches confidentiality by viewing information.

title: Misconfiguration of System
description: ORG IT Staff accidentally misconfigure a system causing an outage or security incident.

title: Unencrypted exchange of documents via e-mail
description: ORG staff, third-party assessor, external-  member or ORG client accidentally send sensitive, confidential, or Protected B information, unencrypted using e-mail.

title: Lost/Stolen Device
description: An ORG staff member or third-party assessor realizes their laptop has been lost or stolen, containing Client Data.  These devices do not leverage hard disk encryption, potentially leaving sensitive data easily exposed to a criminal with minimal time and resources to extract data

title: Hacker targets ORG endpoint(s)
description: An attacker exploits technical vulnerabilities in ORG‚Äôs application and/or workstation with the intention of exfiltrating or destroying sensitive or confidential information

title: ORG Employee accidentally downloads malware
description: Malware infects ORG assets through drive-by-download or phishing causing interruption of service or potential loss of records.

title: Assessor accidentally downloads malware
description: A third-party assessor has a device compromised either by drive-by download, phishing, or theft resulting in client information being exfiltrated.

title: Employee victim of financial fraud
description: An ORG employee with access to accounting software transfers funds to an attacker through a phishing scam whereby the attacker posed as a legitimate business contact

title: ORG Employee Credentials are lost/stolen
description: An ORG employee provides their ORG Active Directory or other application credentials to an attacker through phishing

title: ORG Network or Server Compromised
description: An attacker gains access to ORG network and/or application administrative credentials leveraging weak access controls.
